hero.header:
Artsy’s mission is to make all the world’s art accessible to anyone with an Internet connection.

We are a resource for art collecting and education.

images.credit: Johannes Vermeer, Girl with a Pearl Earring (ca. 1665), Oil on canvas, 44 1/2 × 39 cm
René Magritte, The Healer (Le Thérapeute) (1937), Oil on canvas, 36 1/4 × 25 9/16 in

Adam Avikainen, Ginger Glacier, 2012 ±5,000,000,000 years Frozen heat wave in the form of Ginger Glacier's skin and a monologue with itself possessed by teenaged human

Mark Rothko, Orange, Red and Red (1962), Oil on canvas, 93 1/8 × 80 1/8 in

sections.preamble: To make all the world’s art accessible, Artsy partners with top galleries, museums, institutions, & art fairs. Our growing collection of 140,000+ artworks is one of the largest available online and represents the scope of the art world.  We are creating a platform for art-lovers, collectors, students and educators to discover art.

pullBlurb1.h2: Our collection comes from leading galleries and museums around the world

pullBlurb2.h2: We cover international show openings and art fairs
pullBlurb2.p: In striving to make the art world accessible to an international audience, Artsy has focused on providing comprehensive online coverage of art world events around the world. We want to provide a resource for staying informed and seeing the collections of shows and art fairs before they reach the public.

rightImages.author: Artsy Editorial
rightImages.caption: Bird Sh*t, Bubble Gum, and Crack Pipes: Dan Colen Reflects on his Decade-Long Career

rightImages.author: Artsy Editorial
rightImages.caption: Kanye West’s Surprise Performance at Design Miami/ Basel: Find Out Which Designers He Loves

artworks.header: Second panel of the triptych Dropping a Han Dynasty Urn
L’enlèvement des Sabines (The Rape of the Sabines)

pullBlurb3.p: Artsy allows you to save and organize any works you find in our collection. “Sets” are customizable collections of works you find on Artsy that can be shared or made completely private. Test test test.

pullBlurb4.p: Making the art world accessible means making our collection availble wherever you go. Our iPhone app allows you to browse, save, and collect from anywhere.

sections.preamble: There are currently over 120,000 works available for sale on Artsy provided by our leading international gallery partners. These works range in price from under $1,000 to over $1,000,000, with new ones added every day. Artsy takes no commission from the sale of artworks and just serves as a link between our gallery partners and those interested in collecting.

pullBlurb1.h2: Buying art and design on Artsy
pullBlurb1.p: When you're interested in a for-sale work you can contact the gallery to disucss price, availability, and purchase of the work. They will message you back with the information you are interested in. Often, the more information you give the gallery about yourself, the quicker the response will be. The gallery will help you to arrange shipping to your location, anywhere around world.

pullBlurb2.caption: Image courtesy of The Armory Show
pullBlurb2.h2: Early access to fairs and shows
pullBlurb2.p: Staying in touch with art fairs and gallery openings around the world is tough. We have dedicated pages for the world's art fairs and gallery shows where you can browse the collection well before they open to the public. Get a head-start on finding the work that’s right for you.

pullBlurb3.h2: Follow artists and galleries to receive alerts on new works and shows
pullBlurb3.p: We want to keep you informed on the artists and galleries you love. By following an artist or gallery you will receive weekly emails informing you of shows, news works, and news related to what you follow.

pullBlurb4.h2: We’re here to help you find art
pullBlurb4.p: Artsy specialists are available to all Artsy users, whether you are purchasing your first work or building upon an existing collection. Our specialists join Artsy from leading auction houses, galleries, and museums, and are available to help you find works that you love, with your price range, interests, and current collection in mind. Your specialist can also source works which aren't publicly listed on the site through our international network of gallery partners.

preamble.text: The Art Genome Project is an ongoing study to map the characteristics (known as ‘genes’) that connect the world’s artists and artworks. There are over 1000 genes including art-historical movements, subject matter, and formal qualities.

pullBlurb1.h2: Works are given a genome, or set of categories
pullBlurb1.p: Our team of art historians and experts assign categories and subject matter to works. Genomed works are typically assigned 15 to 25 categories,  ranging from movements like "American Impressionism" to stylistic qualities like "Bright/Vivid" and subject-matter tags like "House" or "Dog". This allows for amazing possibilities of discovery and comparison between the different parts of the art world..

pullBlurb2.h2: Categories are used to connect works and artists
pullBlurb2.p: Our team of art historians and experts work to assign various characteristics and subject matter to our works. This is not a perfect science but allows for amazing possibility of discovery.

sections.preamble: Whether you’re a student, teacher, curator, or collector, Artsy offers a variety of ways to learn about art and design. Most art websites offer few ways to search for art. The Art Genome Project has created over 1,000 categories for discovery and learning, including art-historical movements, subject matter, and formal qualities.

pullBlurb1.p: Artsy provides online access to 160,000+ artworks by 29,000+ artists from 250+ museums and institutions and 1,800+ galleries. Today, more than 25,000 images of art and architecture are also downloadable. Use Artsy to supplement your language, literature and history courses—as well as art history and studio art.

images.author: Matthew Israel
images.caption: The First Modern Painting: Edouard Manet's Le Dejeuner sur l'Herbe (Luncheon on the Grass)

pullBlurb2.p: Our team of art historians and art-world experts are writing a growing library of posts that focus on art-historical content. Coupled with our amazing database of high quality images and the Art Genome Project, our educational content is a great way to learn about art.

pullBlurb3.p: Want to learn quickly about an artist’s life and work? Artsy’s Editorial Team has published over 5,300 biographies of artists—both historically-significant and contemporary—in an approachable style.

leftImages.caption: Image courtesy of The Armory Show
Image courtesy of The Armory Show

pullBlurb4.p: Artsy provides editorial coverage of hundreds of major gallery and museum exhibitions, art fairs, and biennials around the world. Check the Artsy homepage daily for new posts, interviews, and editorial coverage and browse gallery and institutional pages for the latest exhibitions.

jobs.description: You're an experienced full stack software engineer with an impressive track record in building complex distributed applications written in Ruby and JavaScript. You have used relational databases and have some experience with document or key-value stores, such as MongoDB or Redis.
You are a full stack software engineer turned mobile, because you believe in a future where every individual carries a powerful and portable micro-computer.
You're an experienced operations engineer passionate about deployment automation in large and complex distributed systems.
Your mission: define the future of the art experiences. You will drive design projects from start to finish across web, mobile and touch.
Join Artsy's product team and help us execute on our product vision.
We're looking for an art world professional to manage existing relationships and identify new opportunities to expand Artsy’s presence worldwide.
We're looking for an art world professional to manage existing relationships and identify new opportunities to expand Artsy’s presence in Asia.
We're looking for an art world professional to manage existing art fair relationships and identify new opportunities to expand Artsy’s presence worldwide.
We're looking for a flawlessly organized individual with a track record of excellence and an eagerness to learn to support our growing Art Fairs team.
We're looking for an Office and Events Manager to build and maintain our inspiring workplace.
We're looking for an Operations Associate to champion our People and Culture.
We're looking for a Communications Intern to help execute press, media, and event initiatives that strengthen and elevate our brand.
We're looking for a Digital Marketing Intern to help us build and implement our growth and digital marketing strategies.

pullBlurb1.h2: Our team is working to make the art world more accessible

srcs.caption: Brandon and Madeleine of the Genome team at work!

pullBlurb2.p: At its core, Artsy is the convergence of art and science. We’re a team of designers, engineers, and arts professionals who share a passion for bringing the art world into the digital age. Making all the world’s art accessible to anyone with an internet connection is an ambitious goal. Amazing colleagues, challenging problems, and 360-degree views of Manhattan keep us inspired everyday.At its core, Artsy is the convergence of art and science. We’re a team of designers, engineers, and arts professionals who share a passion for bringing the art world into the digital age.

pullBlurb3.p:
At its core, Artsy is the convergence of art and science. We’re a team of designers, engineers, and arts professionals who share a passion for bringing the art world into the digital age.

Making all the world’s art accessible to anyone with an internet connection is an ambitious goal. Amazing colleagues, challenging problems, and 360-degree views of Manhattan keep us inspired everyday.

pullBlurbCTA.p: Our services are completely free to our users and it’s easy to signup. Stay informed on the art world and discover amazing art from around the world.

pullBlurbLeft.p: Our services for institutions include promoting your exhibitions, collections, and programs on your own institutional page on Artsy; and selling limited-edition artworks through Artsy’s e-commerce platform. We also host benefit auctions using cutting-edge web and mobile technology.

pullBlurbRight.p: Our services for institutions include promoting your exhibitions, collections, and programs on your own institutional page on Artsy; and selling limited-edition artworks through Artsy’s e-commerce platform. We also host benefit auctions using cutting-edge web and mobile technology.
